name: Bioperl
description: International association of users & developers of open source Perl tools for bioinformatics, genomics and life sciences. [ paper-2002 | web ]

name: Bioconductor
description: A plethora of tools for analysis and comprehension of high-throughput genomic data, including 1500+ software packages. [ paper-2004 | web ]

name: Biopython
description: Freely available tools for biological computing in Python, with included cookbook, packaging and thorough documentation. Part of the Open Bioinformatics Foundation. Contains the very useful Entrez package for API access to the NCBI databases. [ paper-2009 | web ]

name: Bioconda
description: A channel for the conda package manager specializing in bioinformatics software. Includes a repository with 3000+ ready-to-install (with conda install) bioinformatics packages. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: BioJulia
description: Bioinformatics and computational biology infastructure for the Julia programming language. [ web ]

name: Rust-Bio
description: Rust implementations of algorithms and data structures useful for bioinformatics. [ paper-2016 ]

name: SeqAn
description: The modern C++ library for sequence analysis.

name: (Poly)merase
description: A Go library and command line utility for engineering organisms.

name: Biocaml
description: Biocaml aims to be a high-performance user-friendly library for Bioinformatics.

name: GGD
description: Go Get Data; A command line interface for obtaining genomic data. [ web ]

name: SRA-Explorer
description: Easily get SRA download links and other information. [ web ]

name: Genozip
description: A compressor of common genomic file formats (BAM, CRAM, FASTQ, VCF etc). [ web | paper-2021 ]

name: Bioinformatics One Liners
description: Git repo of useful single line commands.

name: BioNode
description: Modular and universal bioinformatics, Bionode provides pipeable UNIX command line tools and JavaScript APIs for bioinformatics analysis workflows. [ web ]

name: bioSyntax
description: Syntax Highlighting for Computational Biology file formats (SAM, VCF, GTF, FASTA, PDB, etc...) in vim/less/gedit/sublime. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: CSVKit
description: Utilities for working with CSV/Tab-delimited files. [ web ]

name: csvtk
description: Another cross-platform, efficient, practical and pretty CSV/TSV toolkit. [ web ]

name: datamash
description: Data transformations and statistics. [ web ]

name: easy_qsub
description: Easily submitting PBS jobs with script template. Multiple input files supported.

name: Here
description: General parallelizer that runs jobs in parallel on a single multi-core machine. Here are some example scripts using GNU Parallel. [ web ]

name: grabix
description: A wee tool for random access into BGZF files.

name: gsort
description: Sort genomic files according to a specified order.

name: tabix
description: Table file index. [ paper-2011 ]

name: wormtable
description: Write-once-read-many table for large datasets.

name: zindex
description: Create an index on a compressed text file.

name: BigDataScript
description: A cross-system scripting language for working with big data pipelines in computer systems of different sizes and capabilities. [ paper-2014 | web ]

name: Bpipe
description: A small language for defining pipeline stages and linking them together to make pipelines. [ web ]

name: Common Workflow Language
description: a specification for describing analysis workflows and tools that are portable and scalable across a variety of software and hardware environments, from workstations to cluster, cloud, and high performance computing (HPC) environments. [ web ]

name: Cromwell
description: A Workflow Management System geared towards scientific workflows. [ web ]

name: Galaxy
description: a popular open-source, web-based platform for data intensive biomedical research. Has several features, from data analysis to workflow management to visualization tools. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: Nextflow
description: A fluent DSL modelled around the UNIX pipe concept, that simplifies writing parallel and scalable pipelines in a portable manner. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: redun
description: A python-based workflow manager.

name: Ruffus
description: Computation Pipeline library for python widely used in science and bioinformatics. [ paper-2010 | web ]

name: SciPipe
description: Workflow library embedded in the Go programming language, focusing on supporting complex workflow constructs, compiling to a single binary, providing powerful file naming and comprehensive audit reports for every output [ paper-2019 | web ]

name: SeqWare
description: Hadoop Oozie-based workflow system focused on genomics data analysis in cloud environments. [ paper-2010 | web ]

name: Snakemake
description: A workflow management system in Python that aims to reduce the complexity of creating workflows by providing a fast and comfortable execution environment. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: Workflow Descriptor Language
description: Workflow standard developed by the Broad. [ web ]

name: Awesome-Pipeline
description: A list of pipeline resources.

name: Bactopia
description: A flexible pipeline, built with Nextflow, for the complete analysis of bacterial genomes. [ web ]

name: Bacannot
description: A generic but comprehensive bacterial annotation pipeline, built with Nextflow, with nice graphical options for investigating results. [ web ]

name: bcbio-nextgen
description: Batteries included genomic analysis pipeline for variant and RNA-Seq analysis, structural variant calling, annotation, and prediction. [ web ]

name: R-Peridot
description: Customizable pipeline for differential expression analysis with an intuitive GUI. [ web ]

name: ngs-preprocess
description: A pipeline for preprocessing short and long sequencing reads, built with Nextflow. [ web ]

name: AfterQC
description: Automatic Filtering, Trimming, Error Removing and Quality Control for fastq data. [ paper-2017 ]

name: FastQC
description: A quality control tool for high throughput sequence data. [ web ]

name: Fastqp
description: FASTQ and SAM quality control using Python.

name: Fastx Tookit
description: FASTQ/A short-reads pre-processing tools: Demultiplexing, trimming, clipping, quality filtering, and masking utilities. [ web ]

name: MultiQC
description: Aggregate results from bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report. [ paper-2016 | web ]

name: SeqFu
description: Sequence manipulation toolkit for FASTA/FASTQ files written in Nim. [ paper-2021 | web ]

name: SeqKit
description: A cross-platform and ultrafast toolkit for FASTA/Q file manipulation in Golang. [ paper-2016 | web ]

name: seqmagick
description: file format conversion in Biopython in a convenient way. [ web ]

name: Seqtk
description: Toolkit for processing sequences in FASTA/Q formats.

name: smof
description: UNIX-style FASTA manipulation tools.

name: Hail
description: Scalable genomic analysis.

name: GLNexus
description: Scalable gVCF merging and joint variant calling for population sequencing projects. [ paper-2018 ]

name: Bowtie 2
description: An ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences. [ paper-2012 | web ]

name: BWA
description: Burrow-Wheeler Aligner for pairwise alignment between DNA sequences.

name: WFA
description: the wavefront alignment algorithm (WFA) which expoit sequence similarity to speed up alignment [ paper-2020 ]

name: Parasail
description: SIMD C library for global, semi-global, and local pairwise sequence alignments [ paper-2016 ]

name: MUMmer
description: A system for rapidly aligning entire genomes, whether in complete or draft form. [ paper-1999 | paper-2002 | paper-2004 | web ]

name: DIAMOND
description: An ultrafast protein aligner for blastp and blastx like searches. [ paper-2021 ]

name: POA
description: Partial-Order Alignment for fast alignment and consensus of multiple homologous sequences. [ paper-2002 ]

name: MMseqs2
description: Ultra-fast, sensitive search and clustering suite for protein and nucleotide sequence sets. [ paper-2017 | paper-2018 ]

name: Cufflinks
description: Cufflinks assembles transcripts, estimates their abundances, and tests for differential expression and regulation in RNA-Seq samples. [ paper-2010 ]

name: RSEM
description: A software package for estimating gene and isoform expression levels from RNA-Seq data. [ paper-2011 | web ]

name: DeepVariant
description: Deep learning-based variant caller [ paper-2018 ]

name: freebayes
description: Bayesian haplotype-based polymorphism discovery and genotyping. [ web ]

name: GATK
description: Variant Discovery in High-Throughput Sequencing Data. [ web ]

name: Octopus
description: A polymorphic bayesian genotyping model with wide applicability. [ paper-2021 ]

name: bcftools
description: samtools/bcftools are a suite of tools for manipulating NGS data and can be used to call variants. [ paper-2009 | web ]

name: Delly
description: Structural variant discovery by integrated paired-end and split-read analysis. [ paper-2012 ]

name: lumpy
description: lumpy: a general probabilistic framework for structural variant discovery. [ paper-2014 ]

name: manta
description: Structural variant and indel caller for mapped sequencing data. [ paper-2015 ]

name: gridss
description: GRIDSS: the Genomic Rearrangement IDentification Software Suite. [ paper-2017 ]

name: smoove
description: structural variant calling and genotyping with existing tools, but,smoothly.

name: Bamtools
description: Collection of tools for working with BAM files. [ paper-2011 ]

name: mergesam
description: Automate common SAM & BAM conversions.

name: mosdepth
description: fast BAM/CRAM depth calculation for WGS, exome, or targeted sequencing. [ paper-2017 ]

name: SAMstat
description: Displaying sequence statistics for next-generation sequencing. [ paper-2010 | web ]

name: Somalier
description: Fast sample-swap and relatedness checks on BAMs/CRAMs/VCFs/GVCFs. [ paper-2020 ]

name: Telseq
description: Telseq is a tool for estimating telomere length from whole genome sequence data. [ paper-2014 ]

name: bcftools
description: Set of tools for manipulating VCF files. [ paper-2016 | paper-2017 | web ]

name: vcfanno
description: Annotate a VCF with other VCFs/BEDs/tabixed files. [ paper-2016 ]

name: vcflib
description: A C++ library for parsing and manipulating VCF files.

name: vcftools
description: VCF manipulation and statistics (e.g. linkage disequilibrium, allele frequency, Fst). [ paper-2011 ]

name: AGAT
description: Suite of tools to handle gene annotations in any GTF/GFF format. [ web ]

name: gffutils
description: GFF and GTF file manipulation and interconversion. [ web ]

name: BEDOPS
description: The fast, highly scalable and easily-parallelizable genome analysis toolkit. [ paper-2012 ]

name: Bedtools2
description: A Swiss Army knife for genome arithmetic. [ paper-2010 | paper-2014 | web ]

name: Bam Surgeon
description: Tools for adding mutations to existing .bam files, used for testing mutation callers. [ web ]

name: wgsim
description: Comes with samtools! - Reads simulator. [ web ]

name: SIFT
description: Predicts whether an amino acid substitution affects protein function. [ paper-2003 | web ]

name: SnpEff
description: Genetic variant annotation and effect prediction toolbox. [ paper-2012 | web ]

name: Ensembl VEP
description: The VEP determines the effect of your variants (SNPs, insertions, deletions, CNVs or structural variants) on genes, transcripts, and protein sequence, as well as regulatory regions. [ paper-2016 | web ]

name: cruzdb
description: Pythonic access to the UCSC Genome database. [ paper-2013 ]

name: pyensembl
description: Pythonic Access to the Ensembl database. [ web ]

name: bioservices
description: Access to Biological Web Services from Python. [ paper-2013 | web ]

name: cyvcf
description: A port of pyVCF using Cython for speed.

name: cyvcf2
description: Cython + HTSlib == fast VCF parsing; even faster parsing than pyVCF. [ paper-2017 | web ]

name: pyBedTools
description: Python wrapper for bedtools. [ paper-2011 | web ]

name: pyfaidx
description: Pythonic access to FASTA files.

name: pysam
description: Python wrapper for samtools. [ web ]

name: pyVCF
description: A VCF Parser for Python. [ web ]

name: SPAdes
description: SPAdes (St. Petersburg genome assembler) is an assembly toolkit containing various assembly pipelines and the de-facto standard for prokaryotic genome assemblies.

name: SKESA
description: SKESA is a de-novo sequence read assembler for microbial genomes. It uses conservative heuristics and is designed to create breaks at repeat regions in the genome. This leads to excellent sequence quality without significantly compromising contiguity.

name: Prokka
description: Prokka: rapid prokaryotic genome annotation. Prokka is one of the most cited annotation command line tools for microbial genome annotations.

name: Bakta
description: Bakta is a tool for the rapid & standardized annotation of bacterial genomes & plasmids. It provides dbxref-rich and sORF-including annotations in machine-readable JSON & bioinformatics standard file formats for automatic downstream analysis.

name: canu
description: A single molecule sequence assembler for genomes large and small.

name: flye
description: De novo assembler for single molecule sequencing reads using repeat graphs.

name: hifiasm
description: A haplotype-resolved assembler for accurate Hifi reads.

name: wtdbg2
description: A fuzzy Bruijn graph approach to long noisy reads assembly

name: Squiggle
description: Easy-to-use DNA sequence visualization tool that turns FASTA files into browser-based visualizations. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: biodalliance
description: Embeddable genome viewer. Integration data from a wide variety of sources, and can load data directly from popular genomics file formats including bigWig, BAM, and VCF.

name: BioJS
description: BioJS is a library of over hundred JavaScript components enabling you to visualize and process data using current web technologies. [ paper-2014 | web ]

name: Circleator
description: Flexible circular visualization of genome-associated data with BioPerl and SVG. [ paper-2014 ]

name: DNAism
description: Horizon chart D3-based JavaScript library for DNA data. [ paper-2016 | web ]

name: IGV js
description: Java-based browser. Fast, efficient, scalable visualization tool for genomics data and annotations. Handles a large variety of formats. [ paper-2019 | web ]

name: Island Plot
description: D3 JavaScript based genome viewer. Constructs SVGs. [ paper-2015 ]

name: JBrowse
description: JavaScript genome browser that is highly customizable via plugins and track customizations. [ paper-2016 | web ]

name: PHAT
description: Point and click, cross platform suite for analysing and visualizing next-generation sequencing datasets. [ paper-2018 | web ]

name: pileup.js
description: JavaScript library that can be used to generate interactive and highly customizable web-based genome browsers. [ paper-2016 ]

name: scribl
description: JavaScript library for drawing canvas-based gene diagrams. [ paper-2012 | web ]

name: web
description: A modern sequence alignment viewer. [ web ]

name: Circos
description: Perl package for circular plots, which are well suited for genomic rearrangements. [ paper-2009 | web ]

name: paper-2015
description: An interactive web-based service of Circos. [ paper-2015 ]

name: paper-2014
description: R package for circular plots for omics data. [ paper-2014 | web ]

name: paper-2014
description: A Java application for doing interactive work with circos plots. [ paper-2014 | web ]

name: rCircos
description: R package for circular plots. [ paper-2013 | web ]

name: fujiplot
description: A circos representation of multiple GWAS results. [ paper-2018 ]

name: Entrez Direct: E-utilities on the UNIX command line
description: UNIX command line tools to access NCBI's databases programmatically. Instructions to install and examples are found in the link.

name: Bioinformatics Curriculum Guidelines: Toward a Definition of Core Competencies
Top N Reasons To Do A Ph.D. or Post-Doc in Bioinformatics/Computational Biology
A 10-Step Guide to Party Conversation For Bioinformaticians
description: Here is a step-by-step guide on how to convey concepts to people not involved in the field when asked the question: 'So, what do you do?'

name: A History Of Bioinformatics (In The Year 2039)
description: A talk by C. Titus Brown on his take of looking back at bioinformatics from the year 2039. His notes for this talk can be found here.

name: A farewell to bioinformatics
description: A critical view of the state of bioinformatics.

name: A Series of Interviews with Notable Bioinformaticians
description: Dr. Keith Bradnam "thought it might be instructive to ask a simple series of questions to a bunch of notable bioinformaticians to assess their feelings on the current state of bioinformatics research, and maybe get any tips they have about what has been useful to their bioinformatics careers."

name: Open Source Society University on Bioinformatics
description: Solid path for those of you who want to complete a Bioinformatics course on your own time, for free, with courses from the best universities in the World.

name: Rosalind
description: Rosalind is a platform for learning bioinformatics through problem solving.

name: A guide for the lonely bioinformatician
description: This guide is aimed at bioinformaticians, and is meant to guide them towards better career development.

name: Awesome-alternative-splicing
description: List of resources on alternative splicing including software, databases, and other tools.

name: Awesome AI-based Protein Design
description: A collection of research papers for AI-based protein design.

name: Next-Generation Sequencing Technologies - Elaine Mardis (2014)
description: Elaine Mardis (2014) [1:34:35] - Excellent (technical) overview of next-generation and third-generation sequencing technologies, along with some applications in cancer research.

name: Annotated bibliography of *Seq assays
description: List of ~100 papers on various sequencing technologies and assays ranging from transcription to transposable element discovery.

name: For all you seq... (PDF)
description: Massive infographic by Illumina on illustrating how many sequencing techniques work. Techniques cover protein-protein interactions, RNA transcription, RNA-protein interactions, RNA low-level detection, RNA modifications, RNA structure, DNA rearrangements and markers, DNA low-level detection, epigenetics, and DNA-protein interactions. References included.

name: Review papers on RNA-seq (Biostars)
description: Includes lots of seminal papers on RNA-seq and analysis methods.

name: Informatics for RNA-seq: A web resource for analysis on the cloud
description: Educational resource on performing RNA-seq analysis in the cloud using Amazon AWS cloud services. Topics include preparing the data, preprocessing, differential expression, isoform discovery, data visualization, and interpretation.

name: RNA-seqlopedia
description: RNA-seqlopedia provides an awesome overview of RNA-seq and of the choices necessary to carry out a successful RNA-seq experiment.

name: A survey of best practices for RNA-seq data analysis
description: Gives awesome roadmap for RNA-seq computational analyses, including challenges/obstacles and things to look out for, but also how you might integrate RNA-seq data with other data types.

name: Stories from the Supplement
description: Dr. Lior Pachter shares his stories from the supplement for well-known RNA-seq analysis software CuffDiff and Cufflinks and explains some of their methodologies.

name: List of RNA-seq Bioinformatics Tools
description: Extensive list on Wikipedia of RNA-seq bioinformatics tools needed in analysis, ranging from all parts of an analysis pipeline from quality control, alignment, splice analysis, and visualizations.

name: RNA-seq Analysis
description: @crazyhottommy's notes on various steps and considerations when doing RNA-seq analysis.

name: ChIP-seq analysis notes from Tommy Tang
description: Resources on ChIP-seq data which include papers, methods, links to software, and analysis.

name: Current Topics in Genome Analysis 2016
description: Excellent series of fourteen lectures given at NIH about current topics in genomics ranging from sequence analysis, to sequencing technologies, and even more translational topics such as genomic medicine.

name: GenomeTV
description: "GenomeTV is NHGRI's collection of official video resources from lectures, to news documentaries, to full video collections of meetings that tackle the research, issues and clinical applications of genomic research."

name: Leading Strand
description: Keynote lectures from Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory (CSHL) Meetings. More on The Leading Strand.

name: Genomics, Big Data and Medicine Seminar Series
description: "Our seminars are dedicated to the critical intersection of GBM, delving into 'bleeding edge' technology and approaches that will deeply shape the future."

name: Rafael Irizarry's Channel
description: Dr. Rafael Irizarry's lectures and academic talks on statistics for genomics.

name: NIH VideoCasting and Podcasting
description: "NIH VideoCast broadcasts seminars, conferences and meetings live to a world-wide audience over the Internet as a real-time streaming video." Not exclusively genomics and bioinformatics video but many great talks on domain specific use of bioinformatics and genomics.

name: ACGT
description: Dr. Keith Bradnam writes about this "thoughts on biology, genomics, and the ongoing threat to humanity from the bogus use of bioinformatics acroynums."

name: Opiniomics
description: Dr. Mick Watson write on bioinformatics, genomes, and biology.

name: Bits of DNA
description: Dr. Lior Pachter writes review and commentary on computational biology.

name: it is NOT junk
description: Dr. Michael Eisen writes "a blog about genomes, DNA, evolution, open science, baseball and other important things"

name: #!/perl/bioinfo
description: The Computational and Structural Biology group at EEAD-CSIC writes, in Spanish and English, about ideas and code for plant genomics, computational and structural biology problems.

name: The Leek group guide to genomics papers
description: Expertly curated genomics papers to get up to speed on genomics, RNA-seq, statistics (used in genomics), software development, and more.

name: A New Online Computational Biology Curriculum
description: "This article introduces a catalog of several hundred free video courses of potential interest to those wishing to expand their knowledge of bioinformatics and computational biology. The courses are organized into eleven subject areas modeled on university departments and are accompanied by commentary and career advice."

name: How Perl Saved the Human Genome Project
description: An anecdote by Lincoln D. Stein on the importance of the Perl programming language in the Human Genome Project.

name: Educational Papers from Nature Biotechnology and PLoS Computational Biology
description: Page of links to primers and short educational articles on various methods used in computational biology and bioinformatics.

name: The PeerJ Bioinformatics Software Tools Collection
description: Collection of tools curated by Keith Crandall and Claus White, aimed at collating the most interesting, innovative, and relevant bioinformatics tools articles in PeerJ.

name: Bioinformatics (on Discord)
description: a Discord server for general bioinformatics

name: r-bioinformatics
description: the official Slack workspace of r/bioinformatics (send a direct message to apfejes on reddit)

name: BioinformaticsGRX
description: A community of bioinformaticians based in Granada, Spain

name: Comunidad de Desarolladores de Software en Bioinform√°tica
description: A community of bioinformaticians centered in Latin America

name: COMBINE
description: An Austrialian group for bioinformatics students
